discussion.content: B. Implement a management platform for IT services on vSphere and other hypervisors.

questions.question_text:
A company has recently reported a financial loss and has identified that a major part of their expenses is the maintaining and managing of their virtualized network in the data center.
The company needs a solution that would help cut down on their operating expenditures.
What should the company do to solve this issue?

choices.C: Remove all physical servers which are not in use.
choices.D: Increase the number of physical servers.
choices.B: Implement a management platform for IT services on vSphere and other hypervisors.

questions.question_text: After configuring Fault Tolerance for critical servers, an administrate notices that protected virtual machines run slower than usual. What is the reason for performance reduction of these virtual machines?

choices.A: Hosts have lower bandwidth for Fault Tolerance logging.
choices.B: Virtual machines are usually slow after Fault Tolerance logging.
choices.D: Virtual machines are running memory intensive applications.
choices.C: The storage space on the host is low.

discussion.content: A. Hosts have lower bandwidth for Fault Tolerance logging.

questions.question_text: What are two advantages of Network I/O Control? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
B. Performs load-based teaming.
C. Enforces network bandwidth limit on the virtual distributed switch.

choices.C: Enforces network bandwidth limit on the virtual distributed switch.

discussion.content:
A. Storage Policy Based Management
B. vSphere Distributed Switch
D. Distributed Power Management

questions.question_text: Which three vSphere 6.x features require a shared storage infrastructure to work properly? (Choose three.)
An administrator has finished configuring vSphere HA in their IT environment. Which component does the administrator remove from the infrastructure to save cost?
